org.topbraid.spin.util

Class SPINUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.topbraid.spin.util.SPINUtil

  • public class SPINUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Some static util methods for SPIN that don't fit anywhere else.
    Author:
    Holger Knublauch

      The name of the variable that will be used in type binding triple patterns (?this rdf:type ?TYPE_CLASS)

      • addQueryOrTemplateCalls

        public static void addQueryOrTemplateCalls(com.hp.hpl.jena.rdf.model.Resource cls,
                           com.hp.hpl.jena.rdf.model.Property predicate,
                           java.util.List<QueryOrTemplateCall> results)
        Collects all queries or template calls at a given class.
        Parameters:
        cls - the class to get the queries at
        predicate - the predicate such as spin:rule
        results - the List to add the results to

      • addThisTypeClause

        public static java.lang.String addThisTypeClause(java.lang.String str)
        Inserts a statement ?this a ?TYPE_CLASS . after the WHERE { keyword.
        Parameters:
        str - the input String

      • applyBindings

        public static void applyBindings(java.util.Map<com.hp.hpl.jena.rdf.model.Property,com.hp.hpl.jena.rdf.model.RDFNode> map,
                 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,com.hp.hpl.jena.rdf.model.RDFNode> bindings)
        Applies variable bindings, replacing the values of one map with the values from a given variables map.
        Parameters:
        map - the Map to modify
        bindings - the current variable bindings

      • bindThis

        public static void bindThis(com.hp.hpl.jena.query.QueryExecution qexec,
            com.hp.hpl.jena.rdf.model.RDFNode value)
        Binds the variable ?this with a given value.
        Parameters:
        qexec - the QueryExecution to modify
        value - the value to bind ?this with

      • containsThis

        public static java.lang.Integer containsThis(CommandWithWhere command)
        Checks whether a given query mentions the variable ?this anywhere. This can be used to check whether ?this needs to be bound before execution, etc.
        Parameters:
        command - the query to test
        Returns:
        null to indicate it was not found, an int >= 0 representing the max depth inside query element tree otherwise

      • getFirstResult

        public static com.hp.hpl.jena.rdf.model.RDFNode getFirstResult(com.hp.hpl.jena.query.QueryExecution qexec)
        Executes a given SELECT query and returns the first value of the first result variable, if any exists. The QueryExecution is closed at the end.
        Parameters:
        qexec - the QueryExecution to execute
        Returns:
        the first result or null

      • getQueryString

        public static java.lang.String getQueryString(com.hp.hpl.jena.rdf.model.RDFNode node,
                              boolean usePrefixes)
        Deprecated. for the same reason as TemplateCall.getQueryString
        Attempts to convert a given RDFNode to a String so that it can be parsed into a Jena query object. The node must be either a string Literal, or a sp:Query node or a template call. If it's a template call then the resulting query string will "hard-bind" the template variables.
        Parameters:
        node - the RDFNode to convert
        usePrefixes - true to use qname abbreviations
        Returns:
        the String representation of node
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the node is not a valid SPIN Query or a String

      • getQueryStrings

        public static java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getQueryStrings(com.hp.hpl.jena.rdf.model.Resource subject,
                                                     com.hp.hpl.jena.rdf.model.Property property)
        Deprecated. for the same reasons as TemplateCall.getQueryString
        Gets a Collection of all query strings defined as values of a given property. This will accept strings or SPIN expressions (including template calls). The query model is the subject's getModel(). All sub-properties of property from the query model will also be queried.
        Parameters:
        subject - the subject to get the values of
        property - the property to query
        Returns:
        a Set of query strings

      • getQueryStringMap

        public static java.util.Map<com.hp.hpl.jena.rdf.model.Statement,java.lang.String> getQueryStringMap(com.hp.hpl.jena.rdf.model.Resource subject,
                                                                                    com.hp.hpl.jena.rdf.model.Property property)
        Gets a Map of all query strings defined as values of a given property. This will accept strings or SPIN expressions (including template calls). The query model is the subject's getModel(). All sub-properties of property from the query model will also be queried. The resulting Map will associate each query String with the Statement that has created it.
        Parameters:
        subject - the subject to get the values of
        property - the property to query
        Returns:
        a Map of Statements to query strings

      • getURIResources

        public static java.util.Set<com.hp.hpl.jena.rdf.model.Resource> getURIResources(Printable query)

      • isLibraryOntology

        public static boolean isLibraryOntology(com.hp.hpl.jena.graph.Graph graph,
                        java.net.URI baseURI)
        Checks whether a given Graph is a spin:LibraryOntology. This is true for the SP and SPIN namespaces, as well as any Graph that has [baseURI] rdf:type spin:LibraryOntology.
        Parameters:
        graph - the Graph to test
        baseURI - the base URI of the Graph (to find the library ontology)
        Returns:
        true if graph is a library ontology

      • isRootClass

        public static boolean isRootClass(com.hp.hpl.jena.rdf.model.Resource cls)

      • mapProperty2VarNames

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,com.hp.hpl.jena.rdf.model.RDFNode> mapProperty2VarNames(java.util.Map<com.hp.hpl.jena.rdf.model.Property,com.hp.hpl.jena.rdf.model.RDFNode> map)
        Converts a map from Properties to RDFNode values to a Map from variable names (Strings) to those values, for quicker look up.
        Parameters:
        map - the old Map
        Returns:
        the new Map
